title: Design Movement/History
content:
This may not be a direct relation to typography. I am doing a research on the design movement, from 1890s till present.

There are 7 major design styles/movements in history from 1890 to today. They are:  
1. Victorian Era  
2. Art Nouveau Style  
3. Modern Movement  
4. Fifties’ American Kitsch  
5. Post-modern Rebellion  
6. The Contemporary Look  
7. The Digital Age

Now, I am concentrating on the digital age. Is there any articles about this movement’s influences, introductions, or maybe typography in the digital age?

 [‹ Dissertation question\* A comparison between the Graphic Design used during ww1/2 and that of modern conflicts e.g The Iraq War.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225933/http:/typophile.com/node/50523 "Go to previous forum topic") [Blender Pro and Flama ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225933/http:/typophile.com/node/50514 "Go to next forum topic")
author: castro

comments.content: You should have a look at this book called [Typology: Type Design from the Victorian Era to the Digital Age.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225933/http:/books.google.com/books?hl=en&id=-AmB9nxxuaUC&dq=design+in+digital+age&printsec=frontcover&source=web&ots=nCJf63NA_y&sig=P82QJXZZM9GufPuNmxK3rbVJnUY&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=10&ct=result#PPA30,M1)
